message.body:
$AMZN $GOOG $AAPL $NVDA $MSFT  
The Fed wants the markets down & if you understand that this is the plot then your train of thought should be this. 
 
Not until Apple is @ $91.47 a 50% decline from ATH  
 
Not until AMZN is @ $1886.54  
 
Not until TSLA is @ $621.49 
 
Not until GOOG is @ $1521  
 
until then markets are NOT likely to see relief .   Most other stock are down by 40-70% aka "crash"  
 
THIS IS WHAT THE FED WANTS because the illusion right now has become too expensive to maintain.  
 
Good, Bad or Indifferent this is just how it is currently.  The Fed simply printed too many paper/digital dollars

$AMD $MSFT $AAPL $NVDA multiple compression just starting. You're going many of the best under 20PE in next 2 years. 
AMD 50 MSFT 180 AAPL 100 NVDA 80

$SPY $TSLA $NVDA $FB $AAPL 

My thoughts on the CNBC talking heads  ... 

When the bear mkts are surging,  Mr. Cramer tells you to buy stock. Tonight after we are already  down 5% in two days,  he is telling viewers to raise cash. He'sthe worst timer. Please don't listen to Cramer ..

Super bull JP Morgan's Marko Kolanovich told us this week get long, the mkt is going higher. Please don't listen to Marko. 

Speaking of super bulls, Tom Lee of  Fundstrat called for a rip your face off rally in Feb. Ouch. He too is bullish every day. Please don't listen to Mr. Lee. 

The Njarian Brothers. Jon is the new Demnis Gartman. You do the opposite of him. Please don't listen to Jon. 

Joe Terranova. Joe said get long mega cap when SPY was at 460. Ouch. This week he got long fertilizer names, a sector I love but I was touting months ago. Did he just top it? Don't listen to Joe. 

Who do I respect? Dan Niles, Josh Brown, Mike Santoli and David Faber. 

Bottom line, don't rely on talking heads. ✌️

links.description: New research released ahead of Apple Inc's AAPL March quarter results, due on April 28, points toward strong uptake for the latest iteration of its iPhones. What Happened: The entire Apple iPhone 13 lineup had the largest share of the total iPhones sold in the U.S.
